text: The Rensselaer Engineers represented Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute in ECAC women's ice hockey during the 2014–15 NCAA Division I women's ice hockey season. The Engineers had their best season since 2010. ==Offseason== *October 1:Jordan Smelker ('14) was named a member of Team USA for the 4 Nations Cup, heldfrom November 4 to 8 in Sundsvall, Sweden. ===Recruiting=== {|class="wikitable" width="80%" |- align="center" style="background:#F7001F;color:white;" | Player || Position ||Nationality||Notes |- align="center" bgcolor=" " | Kira Bombay || Goaltender || || Minded the Net for Nepean Jr. Wildcats |- align="center" bgcolor="#ccffcc" | Jaimie Grigsby || Forward || || Played for the Whitby Wolves |- align="center" bgcolor=" " | Josefine Hansen || Defense || || Attended Shattuck-St. Mary's |- align="center" bgcolor="#ccffcc" | Ana Orzechowski || Defense || || Blueliner for Pittsburgh Pens Elite |- align="center" bgcolor=" " | Taylor Schwalbe || Forward || || Attended Shattuck-St. Mary's |- align="center" bgcolor="#ccffcc" | Lovisa Selander || Goaltender || || Goalie with SDE Riksserien |- align="center" bgcolor=" " | Makenna Thomas || Forward || || Played with Chicago Young Americans |- align="center" bgcolor="#ccffcc" | Aly Tremblay || Forward || || Played with Minnesota Revolution |- align="center" bgcolor=" " |} == 2015–16 Engineers == ==Schedule== |- !colspan=12 style="background:#F7001F;color:white;"| Regular Season |- !colspan=12 style="background:#F7001F;color:white;"| ECAC Tournament ==Awards and honors== Lovisa Selander, G, Third Team ECAC All-Star Lovisa Selander, G, ECAC All-Rookie Team ==References== Rensselaer Category:RPI Engineers women's ice hockey seasons RPI RPI
